overview.summary: The FieldBoundary module extracts a boundary surface from a volume field.

description.p:
The FieldBoundary module extracts the bounding surface of the incoming field, making it into a new field that it outputs through the BoundaryField port. This module does not have a GUI. It has one input port, Input, and two output ports, Boundary, and Mapping.
The FieldBoundary module builds an appropriate mesh from the incoming field. FieldBoundary will build a QuadSurfMesh, TriSurfMesh, or CurveMesh as appropriate for the boundary type of the input field.
The Boundary output port will contain the new boundary mesh with no data interpolated onto it. If the data from the input field is desired on the output field, we recommended that using the Mapping output, running the results through in order to draw values from the input field.

developer.p: Any interior face should be shared by two cells. The boundary surface is calculated as the module checks each face that is shared by two or more cells. The faces that exist in one cell only are boundary faces. This module can be used as a debugging tool becuase errors or holes in the mesh will show up as boundary faces.

description.p: Accepts any field. Only useful with fields that have faces.
A TriSurfField or QuadSurfField of doubles.
Outputs a mapping from the input volume to the BoundaryField.
Feed the module a volume mesh and render the output.

step.p: The user should see the correct Gouraud shaded faces, along with normals and edges.
Select wireframe in the viewer. There should be no interior faces, although this could be caused by bad input (unconnected volume)

net.title: FieldBoundary Regression Test
net.p: Use the FieldBoundary module to extract just the outside shell of the sphere module, then use to put the values from the original field onto the boundary.
This network can be found at src/nets/Modules/FieldsCreate/FieldBoundary.net.

net.title: FieldBoundary-quadtest Regression Test
net.p: Convert the sphere data set into a HexVol, then test FieldBoundary on that HexVol to make sure that a QuadSurf is created successfully. Then chop a chunk of that closed QuadSurf boundary out and test FieldBoundary on that to make sure that the edge of the cut is properly clipped out. See also FieldBoundary-tritest.net
This network can be found at src/nets/Modules/FieldsCreate/FieldBoundary-quadtest.net.

net.title: FieldBoundary-tritest Regression Test
net.p: Test out the FieldBoundary module on a TetVolMesh, then clip out a chunk of that closed sphere and test FieldBoundary on the resulting TriSurfMesh to make sure that it is detected properly. See also FieldBoundary-quadtest.net
This network can be found at src/nets/Modules/FieldsCreate/FieldBoundary-tritest.net.
